channel.title: Authors on Científicos Mexicanos en el Extranjero
channel.description: Recent content in Authors on Científicos Mexicanos en el Extranjero

item.description:
Somos un grupo multidisciplinario de investigadores mexicanos realizando estancias de investigación en diferentes universidades internacionales, y colaboramos con diversos programas de posgrado en universidades y centros de investigación en México.

Nos encontramos en diferentes países, por supuesto México, varios países de Europa, como son España, Reino Unido, Portugal, Austria, Italia, Francia, además de colaboradores en EUA.

I received the M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in computer science from the Center for Research and Advanced Studies of the National Polytechnic Institute (CINVESTAV-IPN), Mexico, in 2012 and 2017, respectively.

My main research interests involve the study and design of data clustering techniques based on nature-inspired metaheuristics and their applications to problems from areas such as digital image segmentation and machine learning. Recently, I have been focused on the development of a multiobjective evolutionary approach for multi-view data clustering and its application to a range of application domains, ranging from network analysis to medical imaging data.

Abigail Jiménez Franco currently works at the Department of Crystallography, Mineralogy and Mineral Deposits, University of Barcelona, applying electron microscopic techniques to the micro and nano-scale to mineral characterization with focus in hydro-thermal systems. Currently, she is collaborating in Caribbean Lithosphere (CALOR) and ‘Proyecto de Geoparque Comarca Minera de Hidalgo’ projects.

My name is Rosa Maria Vargas Magaña I recently (August 2017) received my Ph.D. in Mathematical Sciences from the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México at (IIMAS), working on non-local shallow water wave models over variable topography under the supervision of Dr. Panayotis Panayotaros.

My principal research interests are: Nonlinear waves, Hamiltonian systems, Surface water waves, Pseudo-dierential operators, Numerical analysis, Fluid dynamics, Geophysical and Engineering applications.
